title: Infosys Q4 Earnings Impact: Brokerages Reduce Price Targets
summary: Following Infosys' weak fourth quarter earnings report, various brokerages have reduced their price targets for the company by 9-13%. This adjustment reflects market concerns about the company's performance and future outlook.
content:
Major brokerages have significantly reduced their price targets for Infosys following the company's disappointing fourth quarter results for the fiscal year. The reduction in targets, ranging from 9% to 13%, comes as a direct response to the company's weaker-than-expected performance.

The market response indicates growing concerns about Infosys' near-term growth prospects and operational challenges. This development has implications for one of India's largest IT services companies and reflects broader trends in the technology sector.

The news has attracted significant attention from investors and market analysts, with various financial institutions reassessing their positions on the stock.

The market response indicates growing concerns about Infosys' near-term growth prospects and operational challenges. This development has implications for one of India's largest IT services companies and reflects broader trends in the technology sector.

The news has attracted significant attention from investors and market analysts, with various financial institutions reassessing their positions on the stock.
